story:
As Reported In



the What

GOBI is the first solar multi-tool.  It is a new idea that moves the concept of a portable solar charger from a collection of solar cells to a handheld device with multiple options for use – a true tool ready made for the field or your home or car.  Part smartphone charger, part flashlight, part lantern, GOBI floats and is built to be tough and compact (it’s about the size of a water bottle).  GOBI has an intelligent design that lets you ‘go be’ you – whether camping, hiking, traveling or at home during a power outage.  With GOBI, you have the assurance that comes with a renewable energy source.

GOBI is a feature-rich device and patent pending with a primary USB connection, magnetic closures, glow-in-the-dark indicators and an 8 volt solar design powering a 4.8V, 800 mAh battery pack - powerful enough to provide a charge to your smartphone and still be able to power either the lantern or flashlight components that are designed to fit within the closed GOBI unit.

There is not other product like GOBI.  Be the first in your group of friends to own it!

GOBI Prototyping


the WHY

GOBI is not just about another solar charger.  It is much more.  Here’s how we see it:

  • It is the only device that uses 3DPV design – a design concept proven to be effective by MIT. 
  • It is the first solar charger that is an integrated design with multiple tools and not just a bunch of solar cells.  
  • GOBI is about you.  It is about people.  We seriously want GOBI to launch in a big way because we see it as that ‘go to’ tool, or device, that people will just want if not need.  Whether a camper in Yosemite, a mom and her kids during a power outage in Atlanta or a student without access to main power in Africa trying to study at night - GOBI just helps fill the void of not having power and does so anywhere in the world – anyone can use it.  
  • GOBI is only the start.  The great Indiegogo folks want us to speak about ‘impact’.  The impact of gaining your support now cannot be understated.  Sure, your support helps with this project.  But, it also helps continue our work.  GOBI is patent pending but Scuint has a number of other ideas and other patents pending and your support today helps move us from empowering people, with only GOBI, to empowering them in new and novel ways.  


Scuint is proud to state it began its work three years ago and before the 3DPV concept was more widely recognized.  In many ways, Scuint is the first mover in 3DPV but Scuint is also fortunate to be able to state its early work is validated by MIT who conducted its research independently from any affiliation with Scuint but also in parallel to Scuint’s efforts.  


Time-lapse Video Showing 3DPV Cells Charging Battery Pack



the Work Ahead

What You Get – We hope you get any of the Perks (but secretly really hope you get GOBI).  Getting GOBI is really getting personal empowerment – the device is built to be rugged and provide for recharging smartphones to lighting the way with both a flashlight and lantern components.  If you choose another Perk, you will be assured of delivery and a high quality item - whether sticker or T-Shirt.

What We Need – Your support.  With your support Scuint can employ the people and teams necessary to improve the GOBI prototype to a well-crafted product you can count on and that you’ll be proud to show your friends – and we assure you - your friends have not seen anything like GOBI before.

Your support is needed to gain the funds for this project and that will be used to improve, fabricate and deliver GOBI.  The projected use of funds is shown below in the following chart.  Use of funds include things that may not be readily obvious such as packaging, shipping and tax (yes, tax, apparently Uncle Sam likes crowd funding too!).


The "Remainder" amounts are the estimated amounts used prior to fulfillment of the Perks and in order to create the high quality product.  These funds will cover items such as CAD services that are needed in order to generate the files used by a 3D printer that can then create the individual parts or molds used to create the final product delivered to you (see "the How" for more insights).



While the above charts explains how the funds from this Campaign will be used.  The below Scope, Risk & Challenges section explains in more detail the work to be completed and the issues associated to successfully completing the work.  This is followed by the Who section and explaining the team.


the How

(Scope, Risks & Challenges)

SCOPE.  Each element of the GOBI design has been tested and validated.  However, all the work to date has been just prototyping - this means relatively quick iterations of design elements molded, shaped and formed more by hand - like an artist - than a true machined approached resulting in that finer product we all know.  The work ahead for GOBI is to move from the really cool prototype to the way cooler true professional product.  This is where the funding from this Campaign gets used.  The funds gets used to develop highly accurate, 3D-printed, components and molds as well as to finalized the printed circuit boards (there are three of them in each GOBI).  Within this work are identified opportunities to further improve GOBI - these opportunities are explained below.


CHALLENGES.  The challenges ahead are limited. Given the GOBI has been iterated through multiple prototypes, we know it can be built. The remaining challenges are limited to areas of specific detail and exact functionality. We have identified the following key challenges: 1.) final printed circuit board design and charge controller/charge booster circuitry; 2.) final design of RUGD units; 3.) waterproofing the GOBI and RUGD units; 4.) small scale versus larger scale production.

Please see the below "Risks" section for more discussion on Challenge #4. For Challenges 1-3 the solution for these challenges is known - the circuitry for various power controllers is already known, selecting the best one for production is the current challenge. Similarly, the RUGD designs are known and tested. The option to include additional user friendly features to the RUGD units is the current challenge. Because the GOBI is made to float, we seek to move it from being weatherproof to waterproof - this is a big challenge and not assured. The method to achieve true waterproofing is evident but the integration of the solution into current design parameters is unknown. Currently, the GOBI should be considered weatherproof and water resistant but not truly waterproof. Please watch for updates during the project on this particular challenge.


RISKS.  As with any project, there are some risks. We have acted to identify the risks and mitigate them where possible - primarily schedule and quality risks. To date, in addition to making a number of functional prototypes, we have engaged a prototyping team and are working with a contract manufacturer to better understand how to make the GOBI as a massed produced device. Like above, the question ahead is not "if" it can be done but "how", or "how best", to get it done. Further, all the components have an assured supply chain. So, we have a high degree of confidence that units can be delivered. The remaining risk is really one of schedule. Can we deliver on time? That is a true unknown and an unknown partly due to the final design elements to be worked out and the quantity of units to make for this project. 

To set expectations, at the end of the funding period, we are allowing for a 30 day design window followed by a two week design/build iteration. Likely, we can move faster than this. But, if we cannot, then on Day 45 after funding, we anticipate the first units start manufacture and are subsequently tested and shipped. Due to the manufacturing process, we also believe the manufacturer will have a number of weeks for processing and allowing first units to ship approximately 60 days after funding. All units will be fulfilled as quickly as possible thereafter. Pending the total count of units to be built, this phase could take a number of weeks. Reasonably, we believe all units can be shipped within the first 90 days after funding. It could take more time but we do not believe it should take much more than this time frame.  Other Perks will be fulfilled sooner.

Our commitment is to build a solid product and to build a community.  This means we also seek to be transparent and will provide timely updates through the whole fulfillment cycle.


the Who

WE CAN DO IT.  Scuint is an Austin, Texas start-up but we like to think of ourselves as a solid group.  Steven, founder and inventor, is an experienced high tech industry veteran with over 20 years in semiconductor and telecommunications including supply chain management, licensing and product management.  Steven has managed product development and contract manufacturing for large, multinational, corporations.  Other team members range from local Austinites to independent contractors from various states such as Oregon and California.  All are experienced professionals in their respective fields – CAD, 3D printing, molding, electrical engineering, solar cell assemblies, contract manufacturing, packaging and shipping.  Behind the ‘hands on’ team is the Scuint Board of Advisors; Mark, Kathy, Mike, Alice;  who are all local Austin professionals that include a CIO, Manufacturing/Operations Executive, CFO and Human Resources consultant.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are glad to gain your support in any way.  We have a purpose and vision; we are on a mission and have a goal.  We want you to be a part of it as you choose to be a part of it.  We want a community. 


Please share this project with your friends.  We hope you have fun with it but to make it just a little more fun offer this contest. 



GOBI Teaser Video




the Perks

Now that you have learned about GOBI and have seen the Perks, there are a couple of things to point out for certain Perks.  Below are the images we plan to use for the GOBI Sticker and the GOBI T-Shirt. 

GOBI Sticker
(Measures 4" x 6")



GOBI T-Shirt-Founder Edition
This image will fill the back of your Founder T-Shirt.  T-Shirts are 100%, white, high quality cotton short sleeve tees.  The basic GOBI T-Shirt has the same image without the "Funder/Founder" and without the "I Made It Happen" taglines.




the FAQs

Below please find the listing of most commonly asked questions and their answers.  We seek to be transparent so please send more questions.

Why did you name it GOBI?

We considered naming our first product after the Gobi Desert to underscore its solar charging capability and thinking that any desert conceptually represents the power of the sun.  We soon realized the name “GOBI” could also be “go be” and that was a perfect fit for what we wanted - a personal and portable power device that empowers its owner to go be them!


Does the flashlight come in different colors such as a red light?

Not yet.  For this campaign and initial product launch, we plan to provide the white light flashlight.  It is a blue/white with a focused beam and very effective - especially for its small size.  Moving forward, we do expect to offer a red light version of the same product and are researching how to provide color lenses that can be contained within the body of GOBI.  

How effective are the flashlight and lantern?

We think highly effective. The flashlight has a concentrated beam and can clearly illuminate objects from 50 feet away.  The lantern emits 10 lumens of warm, yellow/white, light and that can easily light up the interior of a tent or a small room.  Having both together in GOBI allows you the best of both worlds - especially in case of an emergency.

Why NiMH batteries?

It seems like the whole world has turned to Lithium Ion batteries for its portable and recharging needs.  However, to us, NiMH batteries offer a better environmental and technical solution for GOBI.  First, NiMH batteries contain no toxic ingredient and we think that is just better for the planet (and all those that inhabit it).  Second, NiMH batteries also have a higher energy capacity as compared to Lithium Ion batteries allowing for a longer use of power and can be charged hundreds of times.  They are also readily available at nearly all major retail stores.

How can GOBI float?

Each flat section of GOBI is made like a sandwich with different types of urethane materials used for each layer.  The outer layer is a harder and more rigid material where the inner layers are made from a low density, hydrophobic, urethane that provides a light weight, but strong, solution that carries the weight of all the other GOBI components including the batteries.  Please note, the RUGD units are also design to be lightweight and we can state the flashlight unit does float and the lantern unit almost floats (we are still working on this but GOBI, with all components, still floats).

Why did you name the company Scuint?

Because there are a large number of companies providing some form of photovoltaic or solar-thermal solution and each seems to be named “solar something” or “helio that” and we seek to take a different path and provide unique and new solutions.  So, what happens when you stare at the sun?  You squint your eyes.  The term “squint” is also slang for “smart” or “intelligent” and that’s what we want to do - provide smart and intelligent solutions.
story_txt:
As Reported Inthe What
GOBI is the first solar multi-tool.  It is a new idea that moves the concept of a portable solar charger from a collection of solar cells to a handheld device with multiple options for use – a true tool ready made for the field or your home or car.  Part smartphone charger, part flashlight, part lantern, GOBI floats and is built to be tough and compact (it’s about the size of a water bottle).  GOBI has an intelligent design that lets you ‘go be’ you – whether camping, hiking, traveling or at home during a power outage.  With GOBI, you have the assurance that comes with a renewable energy source.
GOBI is a feature-rich device and patent pending with a primary USB connection, magnetic closures, glow-in-the-dark indicators and an 8 volt solar design powering a 4.8V, 800 mAh battery pack - powerful enough to provide a charge to your smartphone and still be able to power either the lantern or flashlight components that are designed to fit within the closed GOBI unit.

There is not other product like GOBI.  Be the first in your group of friends to own it!

GOBI Prototyping

the WHY
GOBI is not just about another solar charger.  It is much more.  Here’s how we see it:

 It is the only device that uses 3DPV design – a design concept proven to be effective by MIT. 
 It is the first solar charger that is an integrated design with multiple tools and not just a bunch of solar cells.  
 GOBI is about you.  It is about people.  We seriously want GOBI to launch in a big way because we see it as that ‘go to’ tool, or device, that people will just want if not need.  Whether a camper in Yosemite, a mom and her kids during a power outage in Atlanta or a student without access to main power in Africa trying to study at night - GOBI just helps fill the void of not having power and does so anywhere in the world – anyone can use it.  
 GOBI is only the start.  The great Indiegogo folks want us to speak about ‘impact’.  The impact of gaining your support now cannot be understated.  Sure, your support helps with this project.  But, it also helps continue our work.  GOBI is patent pending but Scuint has a number of other ideas and other patents pending and your support today helps move us from empowering people, with only GOBI, to empowering them in new and novel ways.  



Scuint is proud to state it began its work three years ago and before the 3DPV concept was more widely recognized.  In many ways, Scuint is the first mover in 3DPV but Scuint is also fortunate to be able to state its early work is validated by MIT who conducted its research independently from any affiliation with Scuint but also in parallel to Scuint’s efforts.  

Time-lapse Video Showing 3DPV Cells Charging Battery Pack

story:
Maiker Faire – The European Edition (Rome, October 2014)

Cleanweb Hakaton (Rome, January 2014)

“Durante la maratona, alcuni team hanno partecipato ad una Challenge lanciata da Authometion - startup nell’ambito della domotica – che ha messo a disposizione dei team hardware, sensori e componenti vari.”

Samsung Electronics Open Innovation 2014

Authomation is part of the Samsung Open Innovation Program 2014.

An Arduino controlled LED Bulb with Souliss

"The result is a light bulb that integrate in any Souliss network, so you can control those from any other board running Souliss or from Android and openHAB (using the openHAB interface on an external board)."

TMNews: Startup italiana crea lampadine wireless comandabili da smartwatch

“Authometion al Maker Faire di Roma, pronte le app Apple e Android. Il cavallo di battaglia di Authometion è stato battezzato "IoTuino". Si tratta del modulo elettronico di controllo, compatibile con la piattaforma Arduino Uno (a cui si richiama nel nome), tramite il quale si possono allestire sistemi di comando delle lampadine "Lyt", comandabili con impulsi radio e come anzi detto con capacità policromatiche.”

LaStampa: La domotica per tutti, con l’open source di Arduino si può

La startup italiana Authometion ha presentato un sistema di illuminazione intelligente flessibile ed economico: “abbattiamo i costi grazie ai software liberi”


Find out more or get in touch with us on www.authometion.com

And if you have any questions contact us at info [at] authometion.com


What is IoTuino?

IoTuino is a 56x23 mm core module, compatible with Arduino UNO, for Internet of Things (IoT).

It is based on an ATMega328P microcontroller, a miniaturized low power Wi-Fi module (IEEE802.1 1b/g/n), a 512Kb SPI Flash, a proprietary 2.4Ghz radio transceiver used to manage our LYT led bulbs, and an integrated mini USB programming port.          


          


What does IoTuino do?

IoTuino enables any object to connect to the internet and interact with the real world thanks to the open-source Arduino development platform. For this reason IoTuino is the perfect partner for Home Automation applications.

Turn any home into a smart home.!

... but there is one more thing! IoTuino is the first and only development board that smoothly incorporates a native control over smart led bulbs!


    



IoTuino can totally control our LYT, a smart led bulb!

LYT is a 9W RGB-W radio led bulb that can be completely controlled by IoTuino with the integrated radio transceiver that we have developed: from your smartphone, tablet, or laptop you can switch on/off, change the RGB color, and change the brightness because each LYT is dimmable!!!

You can manage and control your home lightning by using our LYTs as if they were wireless sensors!

Do you want to controll many many lights in your home? No problem! With a single IoTuino you can control up to 65.000 LYT led bulbs!

                


            


    


IoTuino: Arduino-compatible WiFi core module for IoT with integrated lighting control

For the first time developers will have the possibility, using the popular Arduino environment, to control our LYT as a wireless sensor! 

IoTuino and LYT can already be used with IFTTT,  Zapier, and any other automation services through our free WebApp available for Windows, OSX and Linux.

         

Web App screenshoot. Control your LYT from any place in the world.                  


IFTTT schema example with internal trigger generated by a PIR sensor.


Look how simple is to control the LYT from your code!!!



Do you want some technical specifications?


IoTuino technical specs:              



LYT tecnical specs:


        

Start turning your ideas into real products with IoTuino!


Preorder your IoTuino & LYT kit right now…

… and start turning your ideas into real products!

With IoTuino and LYT in your hands you will be able to think, build, and enjoy new features for your smart home.

Join the AUTHOMETION community and unlock your creativity and imagination

Help us to make it real!!!


FUNDING & TIMELINE: HELP US ACHIEVE €50.000 SO AS TO MOVE FROM PROTOTYPING TO MASS-PRODUCTION

The Internet of Things will drive us to a brand new dimension. This is a new revolutionary way of life!

Would you like to live in this new world, and actually lead the change?

We need your help to make this happen.

Please support our crowdfunding campaign so as to move forward from prototyping to mass-production

We need to confirm the supply agreement for large batches of units, start off the assembly, and finalize certification & homologation.

So far, we have been working on small and expensive batches to build our prototypes for development boards and smart led bulbs, and we have succeeded to bootstrapping the operations in order to validate our assumptions and deliver a full-fledged working prototype, including hardware and software/firmware.

But now we need to move to bigger batches in order to make it sustainable on a larger scale, and allow all makers and developers around the world to get their own kit at an affordable price... And start turning ideas into real products!

We and our suppliers are ready and committed to deliver the best product and guarantee a rewarding user experience.

Expected delivery date: within January 2015.

With IoTuino and LYT in your hands you will be able to think, build, and enjoy new features for your smart home!

Join the AUTHOMETION community and unlock your creativity and imagination!

Thank you very much for your support!!!


ABOUT US

Behind Authometion there is a group of people passionate about new technologies, open source platforms, and most of all about the Internet of Things!

The vision that we have is a world where Home Automation is accessible and affordable to everyone, where there is no need for any wired and expensive controlling devices, nor complex installation from technicians. And where YOU  will be able to manage your smart home systems from any smartphone, tablet, or laptop.

Whenever you want, wherever you are.

A future where your home, your smart home, will be equipped with state-of-the-art technology that will enable any household not only to remotely control lighting, HVAC (heating, ventilation and air conditioning), kitchen appliances, and security systems, but to actually “automate” any actions when triggered by specific events and scenarios.

The end goal that we envisage is to improve convenience, comfort, energy efficiency, and security in your most important place. Your home.

This is why we have founded Authometion and developed IoTuino, a WiFi core module to be embedded in any object and enable the Internet of Things revolution. But this is just our starting point...

In fact, since one of the most sought-after applications in Home Automation is lighting control, we have decided to start from here and develop LYT, a smart led bulb completely controllable by IoTuino. This is the first time ever that you can enjoy such bundling.

Last but not least, we have decided to work in an open-source environment to offer the best development platform to the makers community.


Pietro Moscetta is a tech-savvy geek entrepreneur holding 25 years of experience in HW, SW, and FW development especially for remote control applications and devices. He is an expert in the design of microcontroller systems to collect data and signals from multiple sensors, and to process and transfer such data through any kind of wired (RS232, RS485, RS422) and wireless (WiFi, Bluetooth, GPRS, Radio) technology. Despite all his experience and knowledge in the tech world, his wife still wonders why he cannot understand how a woman works!



Find out more or get in touch on www.authometion.com.

...and if you have any questions contact us at info [at] authometion.com


FAQ

Why the shipping costs are not included in the perks?
Shipping costs may vary depending on the country. It is easier to handle shipping separately.  

How much is shipping cost?

For shipping to Europe please refer to the following chart, and remember to add the cost when submitting your order for the perk:

If you have any questions please contact us.


How do you add the shipping cost?

When you select your perk and then are asked “How much would you like to contribute?” all you need to do is enter the total contribution amount just below.

Such amount will be the sum of the price of your selected perk and the shipping cost relative to your country.

What if I forgot to add the additional shipping cost?
After the project is successfully funded and we are ready to ship our products, we will contact each contributor to confirm shipping details.

If you did not add the shipping cost when you contributed, you can add it then.

What about customs duty?

Please check the customs duty policy in your country.

When accepting goods that have been shipped internationally, we encourage you to consider the import fees or duties (if any) that vary by country, which you are responsible for paying. You can visit www.dutycalculator.com  to see what your import duties for your country could be. 

When will my perk be shipped?

We plan to start all the operations for mass-production immediately after the end of the crowdfunding campaign.

Expected delivery time is within January 2015.


Find out more or get in touch with us on www.authometion.com

And if you have any questions contact us at info [at] authometion.com

LaStampa:
La domotica per tutti, con l’open source di Arduino si può
La startup
italiana Authometion ha presentato un sistema di illuminazione intelligente
flessibile ed economico: “abbattiamo i costi grazie ai software liberi”




Find out more or get
in touch with us on www.authometion.com
And if you have any
questions contact us at info [at] authometion.com



What is IoTuino?

IoTuino is a 56x23 mm core module, compatible with Arduino UNO, for Internet of Things (IoT).
It is based on an ATMega328P microcontroller, a miniaturized low power Wi-Fi module (IEEE802.1 1b/g/n), a 512Kb SPI Flash, a proprietary 2.4Ghz radio transceiver used to manage our LYT led bulbs, and an integrated mini USB programming port.                    What does IoTuino do?
IoTuino
enables any object to connect to the internet and interact with the
real world thanks to the open-source Arduino development
platform. For
this reason IoTuino is the perfect partner for Home Automation
applications.
Turn
any home into a smart home.!
...
but there is one more thing! IoTuino
is the first and only development board that smoothly incorporates a
native control over smart led bulbs!
    

IoTuino can totally control our LYT, a smart led bulb!
LYT is a 9W RGB-W radio led bulb that can be completely controlled by IoTuino with the integrated radio transceiver that we have developed: from your smartphone, tablet, or laptop you can switch on/off, change the RGB color, and change the brightness because each LYT is dimmable!!!
You can manage and control your home lightning by using our LYTs as if they were wireless sensors!
Do you want to controll many many lights in your home? No problem! With a single IoTuino you can control up to 65.000 LYT led
bulbs!
                


            


    IoTuino: Arduino-compatible WiFi core module for IoT with integrated lighting control
For the first time developers will have the possibility, using the popular Arduino environment, to control our LYT as a wireless sensor! IoTuino and LYT can already be used with IFTTT,  Zapier, and any other automation services through our free WebApp available for Windows, OSX and Linux.         Web App screenshoot. Control your LYT from any place in the world.                  IFTTT schema example with internal trigger generated by a PIR sensor.Look how simple is to control the LYT from your code!!!Do you want some technical specifications?IoTuino technical specs:              


LYT tecnical specs:



        

Start turning your ideas into real products with IoTuino!Preorder your IoTuino & LYT kit right now…… and start turning your ideas into real products!With IoTuino and LYT in your hands you will be able to think, build, and enjoy new features for your smart home.Join the AUTHOMETION community and unlock your creativity and imaginationHelp us to make it real!!!FUNDING & TIMELINE: HELP US ACHIEVE €50.000 SO AS TO MOVE FROM PROTOTYPING TO
MASS-PRODUCTION
The Internet of Things
will drive us to a brand new dimension. This is a new revolutionary way of
life!
Would you like to live in
this new world, and actually lead the change?
We need your help to make
this happen.
Please support our
crowdfunding campaign so as to move forward from prototyping to mass-production
We need to confirm the
supply agreement for large batches of units, start off the assembly, and finalize
certification & homologation.
So far, we have been
working on small and expensive batches to build our prototypes for development boards and smart led bulbs, and we have succeeded to bootstrapping the
operations in order to validate our assumptions and deliver a full-fledged
working prototype, including hardware and software/firmware.
But now we need to move
to bigger batches in order to make it sustainable on a larger scale, and allow
all makers and developers around the world to get their own kit at an affordable price... And start turning
ideas into real products!
We and our suppliers are
ready and committed to deliver the best product and guarantee a rewarding user experience.Expected delivery date: within January 2015.With IoTuino and LYT in
your hands you will be able to think, build, and enjoy new features for your
smart home!
Join the AUTHOMETION
community and unlock your creativity and imagination!
Thank you very much for
your support!!!ABOUT US
Behind Authometion there is a group of people passionate
about new technologies, open source platforms, and most of all about the
Internet of Things!
The vision that we have is a world where Home Automation
is accessible and affordable to everyone, where there is no need for any wired
and expensive controlling devices, nor complex installation from technicians. And
where YOU  will be able to manage your smart home systems from any smartphone, tablet,
or laptop.
Whenever you want, wherever you are.
A future where your home, your smart home,
will be equipped with state-of-the-art technology that will enable any
household not only to remotely control lighting, HVAC (heating, ventilation and
air conditioning), kitchen appliances, and security systems, but to actually
“automate” any actions when triggered by specific events and scenarios.
The end goal that we envisage is to improve convenience,
comfort, energy efficiency, and security in your most important place. Your
home.
This is why we have founded Authometion and developed
IoTuino, a WiFi core module to be embedded in any object and enable the
Internet of Things revolution. But this is just our starting point...
In fact, since one of the most sought-after
applications in Home Automation is lighting control, we have decided to start from here
and develop LYT, a smart led bulb completely controllable by IoTuino. This is
the first time ever that you can enjoy such bundling.
Last but not least, we have decided to work in an open-source environment to offer the best development platform to the makers
community.Pietro Moscetta is a tech-savvy
geek entrepreneur holding 25 years of experience in HW, SW, and FW development
especially for remote control applications and devices. He is an expert in the
design of microcontroller systems to collect data and signals from multiple
sensors, and to process and transfer such data through any kind of wired
(RS232, RS485, RS422) and wireless (WiFi, Bluetooth, GPRS, Radio) technology. Despite
all his experience and knowledge in the tech world, his wife still wonders why he
cannot understand how a woman works!Find out more or get in touch on www.authometion.com....and if you have any questions contact us at info [at] authometion.comFAQ

Why the shipping costs are not included in the perks?Shipping costs may
vary depending on the country. It is easier to handle shipping separately.  How
much is shipping cost?
For shipping to Europe please refer to the following chart, and remember to add the cost when submitting your order for the perk:If you have any questions please contact us.
How
do you add the shipping cost?
When you select your perk and then are asked “How much would you like to contribute?” all you need to do is enter the total contribution amount just below.
Such amount will be the sum of the price of
your selected perk and the shipping cost relative to your country.
What if I forgot to add the additional shipping
cost?
After the project is successfully funded and we are ready to ship our products,
we will contact each contributor to confirm shipping details.
If you did not add the shipping cost when you
contributed, you can add it then.
What
about customs duty?
Please check the customs duty policy in your
country.
When accepting goods that have been shipped internationally, we encourage you to
consider the import fees or duties (if any) that vary by country, which you are
responsible for paying. You can visit www.dutycalculator.com  to see what your import duties for your country could be. 
When will my perk be
shipped?
We plan to start all the operations for
mass-production immediately after the end of the crowdfunding campaign.
Expected delivery time is within January 2015.Find out more or get in touch with us on www.authometion.comAnd if you have any questions contact us at info [at] authometion.com

story:
For many of us it happens every morning, especially when running late. You are on your way out the door and your keys are nowhere to be found! It’s a frustrating situation and a bad way to start your day. But what if you could simply walk out the door? Better yet, what if you never needed those keys again? Upgrading your door with an advanced fingerprint lock can make it all possible.

 

 

Most fingerprint locks currently on the market are bulky, difficult to install, expensive and lack accuracy. That’s why we invented BrillLock. A smart fingerprint door lock with minimalist styling that is easy to install, meticulously accurate and amazingly affordable.

 

 

 

 

Say goodbye to fumbling for your keys in the doorway. BrillLock is easy to use without the need for keys.

Complement your home style with BrillLock’s simple and elegant look that matches any door style.
 

 

 

Integrated with a 360° fingerprint interface, BrillLock identifies the user and unlocks the door within 0.5 seconds.
 

 

With only a screwdriver, you can install BrillLock in just a few minutes. Most importantly, it costs less than most other smart locks on the market.

 

 

 

 

Your security is our priority. Equipped with an anti-theft semiconductor sensor, BrillLock has a FAR (False Acceptance Rate) rate lower than 0.001%, which means that it is virtually impossible to unlock the door with unverified biometrics.
 

 

Built with the most advanced and safest level C lock cylinder, BrillLock is made to be secure, reliable and unhackable.

 

 

Hidden keyhole and fingerprint interface design adds an additional layer of security for you and your family.

 

 

 

 

Versatility and ease of use are essential. BrillLock is designed with 2 modes so you can streamline your daily activities. Enable the Lock Down Mode to securely lock the front door of your house, your dormitory, a locker, or rental home.

 

 

Conveniently switch to Smart Open Mode to keep the room doors unlocked at home, at your business or in the office.

 

 

 

 

 

  •  Long battery Life 

BrillLock runs on two lithium-ion batteries that last for up to 3,000 entries. When the battery power is low, the LED light will flash red to remind you to charge it.

 

 

 

  • Various Compatibility

BrillLock is compatible with most EU locks, North American locks and Swiss lock cylinders.

 

 

 

  •  All-Metal Body 

BrillLock is made with a combination of stainless steel and zinc alloy. The polished metal is secure & durable and gives the body a sleek and elegant look.

 

 

 

  •  L-Shaped Handle 

Fits the American safety standard.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Founded in October 2012, OursBear has produced a wide range of safety electronics and solutions for consumers. Aiming to provide customers with the most advanced technological products, we use the best materials on the market to deliver the highest-quality products that solve problems and add convenience to daily lives.

story:
Izaya 58 Enterprises 

is a faith based business that, using the profits from the sales of "THE STEAL SHIELD" is committed to address and meet the needs of the poor, the addicted, the hungry, the homeless, helpless and the socially outcast.  We want to make a difference in the world we live in. This product, this dream, this opportunity is not to fill our pockets with money. Rather, help others experience the hope, the love and the grace that we have experienced ourselves. 

THE STEAL SHIELD: 

Bill Disher was born and raised in a small Southwestern Ontario town. After 30 years of serving the Ontario Provincial Police, he is now retired and residing along the shores of Lake Erie.  It was because of his time serving the public and investigating that he found a need for a reliable, secure trailer lock.  This.. is the Steal Shield. 

Helping this campaign will bring peace of mind to your family, friends, and even yourself. An individual can invest hundreds and thousands of dollars into their business and personal lives. And, in an instant, that can be stolen from the. The Steal Shield protects what is important to you and your family. 

By donating to this campaign, you will help us be able to help others "Lock it and Leave it." 

What We Need & What You Get

Here it is: 
We are asking for $130,000 USD.  When collected, this money will be used to build new molds for all models as well as for new product, new capital for more research and developement and broader ability to penetrate more of the market through more extensive and intensive advertsing.

If we don't reach our goal, your funds that you donate are safe. They will be given back to you so there will be no loss to you.  Honestly, we're hoping that doesn't happen.. We're hoping and praying that we DO reach our goal.. with your help, of course.  But we felt it necessary to share with you, just so there is no worry. 

Here's the good news though! For your contribution, you will be the first recieve the new production Steal Shield models as well as other Steal Shield perks like clothing, hats, 3 styles of backpacks, credit card holders all with the Steal Shield logos.

The Impact

Your help will get the Steal Shield into the hands of public and strike back at ever increasing theft and exorbitant insurance costs 

The testimonials found on our website (www.stealshield.net) indicate how many of our loyal customers have realized a greater sense of security and peace of mind. 

Steal Shield works. It's as simple as that. It has been tested extensively and the public's response has more than proved it's value, reliability and worth.  

Risks & Challenges

We know that with anything comes risk. We've experienced that. Everyone has. Which is why we believe in this product so strongly. Because when you purchase a Steal Shield, you are, in fact, lessening the risk in your life. And that makes us happy.  

Our goal is to get the Steal Shield into the hands of each and every trailer owner. We want to go above and beyond with name brand recognition and customer awareness so that customers will be able to ask for the Steal Shield by name. 

We have put in the time, the "blood, sweat and tears" and patience into our product. We have listened to the consumer at trade shows, tweaked our product to meet the needs of our loyal customers and we feel that we have the best trailer security product on the market today. 

We will continue to this to our customers.. our.. "growing family." As we do, we hope to introduce more "Anti-Theft" products that are still now on the drawing board. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word. Give us a "thumbs up" (.. or.. like us) on Facebook - -- (Click Here!)

We're also on Twitter, so be sure to follow us for new updates with what is happening behind the scenes.

At the end of the day, we're looking for everyone to help spread the word about this campaign. Word of mouth is one of the best ways to spread the word.. so please help us to spread the word. 

Help us "Lock it and Leave it"

Thank you!

story:
We build environmentally friendly water generators for those without clean drinking water. Our new smart technology, Dew Point Intelligence™, will make creating water from the air energy-efficient. Under the right conditions, our water can cost as little as two cents (USD) a liter.

It will take approximately three to four months for us to build a working prototype of our new smart technology. We know this technology will work but are lacking the funds to complete it. We have put together this campaign to help raise the $200,000 we need to do this.

 

Benefits of Dew Point Intelligence

To quote water.org, “Without water, life would not exist. It is a prerequisite for all human and economic development. Yet today, 780 million people – about one in nine – lack access to clean water. More than twice that many, 2.5 billion people, don’t have access to a toilet.”

We do not claim to be “the” one solution to the world’s water crisis but we know we can help if we are given a chance to complete our prototype.

By helping provide drinking water to people whose only water source is badly polluted or in scarce supply, we can help save lives. How pure is our water? Check out a water report from our ten-year-old prototype here.

Under the right conditions, our water can cost as little as two cents (USD) per liter. How much of a financial savings is this over current technology? The infographic below illustrates the savings from Dew Point Technology.

For a larger PDF version of this infographic, please click here.  

Our Dew Point Intelligence insures energy efficient water production by carefully tuning and controlling the refrigeration unit. Here are four ways it does this:

  • Dew point is maintained on the coil, which means water is being consistently created in an economical manner.
  • We are able to operate at much lower ambient temperature than current technology.
  • The coils will not freeze causing costly damage.
  • The compressors do not operate unless needed, sparing them from unnecessary wear. Energy savings can be up to 92% of the compressor energy (85% of the entire unit) at high humidity (90-95% humidity) and, this is at any operating ambient temperature when compared to existing refrigeration technology.

When natural disasters occur, bringing in one of our portable units can save lives. Earthquakes, tornados, hurricanes, and even floods can destroy water mains and pollute existing water supplies.

Below you will see an artist's rendering of how our Atmospheric Water Generator will be made mobile and transported to disaster zones. This unit is totally self-contained and ready to operate. For more information about our mobile unit, please visit our website here.

 

Environmentally friendly alternate energy sources are compatible with our water generators. Our machines are custom built and can be adapted to any adequate power source. Solar, wind, hydro-electricity, geo-thermal, and biomass power sources can all power our generators.

Unlike reverse osmosis and desalinization (more info here), we do not harm the environment. The only byproduct we produce is slightly warmer and cleaner air exiting the machine. And, when the water filters are periodically flushed with water, the resulting water can be used to water plants. 

Our water does not require bottling; it can be piped directly to a spigot in a home or a central location for many. Delivering water in this manner removes the need for manufacturing plastic water bottles, another process that causes harm to the environment.

Our water generators are manufactured in the United States (Gilroy, California). Completing our working prototype will lead to us being able to employ more people and will create a jobs for the people monitoring the water machine on location.

 

Dew Point Intelligence features remote monitoring. Our engineers can monitor and in many cases, reprogram the machine remotely via internet or satellite.

Dew Point Intelligence extends the lifespan of the compressors, adding longevity to the unit.

 

Where is the money going?

Our Goal:  $200,000

Indiegogo & PayPal fees:  $14,000

Hardware (A custom made stainless steel frame to hold the new compressors and new refrigeration components, copper piping, a new controller, miscelaneous sensors, wiring and refrigeration): $110,000        

Labor to install hardware:  $12,000

Extensive Programming:  $7,000          

Patent Work:  $18,000

Campaign gift costs with shipping:  $10,000

Campaign expenses:  $3,000    

Donation to Water.org:  $10,000

Remaining balance:  $16,000        

The remaing balance will cover additional costs of the campaign and project. The power costs alone (for running tests and operating) will use at least half of the remaing balance.

The company directors are not being paid. There is no profit taking at all. Funds are being used to strictly to reimburse real costs of the project and the campaign. Our help is contracted help.

All present internal hardware on our existing unit will be removed with the exception of the coils. 

 

How do you create water from the air?

Air and its humidity are drawn into a custom-built refrigeration unit through its air filters. The filtered air is then pulled to the refrigeration coils. At the correct dew point, newly created water will condense on the coils. 

The water is then collected, passed through a water filter and treated with ozone to keep it bacteria free during storage. In our sealed system, ozone will not allow any bacteria to grow.

 

For a larger PDF version of this infographic, please click here. 

 

What does Dew Point Intelligence do?

Atmospheric water generation varies with temperature and humidity just as solar and wind technologies vary with environmental changes. Temperatures can soar during the day lowering the humidity. And, temperatures cool off during the night causing the humidity to climb quite high. 

So, it is necessary to carefully program and adjust the atmospheric water generator to follow the changes in temperature and humidity that create dew point. Our smart technology expands the range of atmospheric water generation (from just above freezing to about 130° F/54.44°C) that is possible without deicing via hot gas by-pass technology. 

Are you curious about at what temperature and humidity dew point occurs? The chart below shows exactly when dew point occurs and water can be created on the fins of our coils. 

For a larger PDF view of this graphic, please click here.

 

We will be installing the new smart technology and testing it on our large machine located in Gilroy, California. The machine presently is a 60-ton refrigeration unit, with two independent refrigeration circuits utilizing two 15-ton compressors in tandem per independent circuit. It will be completely upgraded internally to install Dew Point Intelligence. For more information about the unit, please click here.

 

Below you will find a projected water production chart showing how much water can be produced after we install our Dew Point Intelligence on this unit.

Accuracy is within 10%, which is based on software accepted by the United States Department of Energy. For a larger PDF view of this graphic, please click here.

 

What happens if we raise more than $200,000?

Our initial goal is to raise $200,000. When we reach this goal, we will be able to install our Dew Point Intelligence along with the needed new hardware on our atmospheric water generator located in Gilroy, California. And, we will donate 5% of the funds we raise to water.org.

If we raise $1,000,000 or more we plan to build and donate water machines to those in need. Donating these machines will not only provide clean water to those in need, it will provide us with massive amounts of data to further improve our systems.

We will provide more information as our campaign progresses.

 

 

How do we calculate the energy savings from Dew Point Intelligence?

When an atmospheric water generator is operating at 100°F/37.77°C and 30% relative humidity, it requires 4 compressors at 100 amps /460 volts to reach a dew point of 63°F/17.22°C plus an additional 5°F (now 58°F/14.44°C) to insure proper temperature throughout the coil. Therefore 42°F (100° – 58° = 42°) of refrigeration is needed.

If the same generator is operating at 100°F/37.77°C and 85% relative humidity, one compressor is needed at 24 amps/460 volts to reach a dew point of at 95°F/17.22°C plus an additional 5°F (now 90°F/32.22°C) to insure proper temperature throughout the coil. Therefore only 10°F (100°F – 90°F = 10°F) of refrigeration is needed.

Dew Point Intelligence has created an energy savings of 76.2% or is using 23.8% (10 divided by 42 = .238) of full power at 30% humidity.

 

What is the average energy savings and how much would it cost for our DPI 18-21 to produce water in Thailand?

 

What is the average energy savings and how much would it cost for our DPI 18-21 to produce water in South Africa?

 

Our Dew Point Intelligence water costs explained

Water costs per gallon/liter are based on the following assumptions:

  • The cost and size of the atmospheric water generator with a ten-year amortization. We amortize for ten years even though the generator may last twenty-five years.
  • The cost of power (three phase commercial ratings only) per kWh at the unit’s location.
  • The temperature and humidity averages of the area for at least one year (hourly averages if available). High temperatures with low humidity are taken out of the formula because the atmospheric water generator is programmed to turn off and restart when humidity increases.

Low humidity happens predominately during peak energy costs (hot dry afternoons)...which is why the analysis needs to be done by the hour. The machine is programmed to cut out costly low humidity water production. The lower the humidity at any temperature, the less water the atmospheric water generator will produce (see the water production chart above) as well as having higher power costs.

At 25-30% humidity the atmospheric water generator is running at full power to meet dew point requirements. But, when humidity goes up, the refrigeration can be cut back considerably and to still meet dew point requirements to condense water. The client and our engineers decide upon the unit’s humidity cut off point.

An excellent example of how this works is found in the report we put together for Saudi Arabia.

Saudi Arabia is an excellent location for atmospheric water generation based not only on temperature and humidity but some of the best power costs we have seen to date. Below you will find an analysis chart showing the energy costs and water production based on a unit with a limited 19-hour water production schedule. The 19 hour water production schedule was agreed upon not just because of low humidity but the schedule also coincided with off-peak energy costs of $0.04 (USD).

The chart below is based on more than just energy cost differences. When we examined the past year’s temperatures and humidity, we discovered that approximately 26% of the year has very high temperatures with less than 29.5% humidity. We recommend that the unit be turned off during these times of high temperatures and low humidity.

The chart below clearly shows how choosing your operating schedule affects the final cost of water.

  

Additional Uses for Dew Point Intelligence

Our pending patent is for using refrigeration to remove condensation from the air. This smart technology works well for any dehumidification need. It minimizes energy use by tightly controlling the refrigeration system and reducing unnecessary compressor usage. Higher humidity at any temperature will also lower costs and the noise level.

The dehumidification process will mean significant energy savings for not just atmospheric water but also controlling humidity in commercial buildings, drying out water damaged homes and buildings, and much more.

 

Our Team

In 1998 (Incorporated in 2002), we started developing air to water generators. Unlike the dot-com organizations that were prevalent at that time, we did not want to grow the business only on an idea and the sale of stock. We wanted to serve our fellow human beings throughout the world. To that end, founders Jeffrey Bagley and Dick Corso have worked to develop technology that will help as many as possible.

Jeffrey W. Bagley, Co-Founder

Jeffrey is concurrently the President of The Gold Torch, a thriving jewelry manufacturing firm that he founded almost 30 years ago in San Jose, California.  Serving both domestic and international customers, earnings for The Gold Torch have grown three-fold over the last 10 years. Jeffrey directs product design, operations and all business development activities for the company. Over the past 40 years Mr. Bagley has owned several firms in the manufacturing and retail industries, taking concepts (such as a pivoting and locking clamp) from the idea stage and shepherding them into flourishing business ventures. Jeffrey also co-invented a liquid cooling system for computers and an optical on-demand defrost system for refrigeration with his brother, Alan Bagley.

Richard “Dick” Corso, Co-Founder

With over 40 years experience in Sales, Executive Management and Business Development, Dick has owned his own business for 30 years. His sales and entrepreneurial skills have ranked him in the top 1% of people in each of the three industries that he has been involved.  In his early sales career, he was a top producer in three different companies each of which had sales representatives in the thousands. Since founding Midwest LMI (Leadership Management Inc.) over 30 years ago, he has worked with start-up companies, Fortune 100 companies and the range of sizes in between. Some of his more noted clients are General Electric, Allstate, Sears, Abbott Labs, AT&T, The U.S. Postal Service, General Motors as well as other Governmental Agencies and Utility Companies and many more. Dick has personally been involved with the motivation training of several Olympic figure skaters. Dick has served on numerous Boards of Directors for both charitable and for-profit organizations. Some of the Boards that he served are The Boy Scouts of America, Cancer Treatment Research Foundation, International Organization of Women Executives and many more. He has also taught Management and Marketing classes at several Colleges and Universities such as Harper College and The University of Northeastern Illinois. 

Alan Bagley, Co-Founder

As an electrical and mechanical engineer, Alan was responsible for the introduction and design of Air to Water Technologies' atmospheric water generators. He was a valued advisor until he passed away in 2012.

Keith Lucia, Chief Refrigeration Guru

Keith has over 30 years of experience in the refrigeration industry. He has worked on refrigeration applications for both supermarkets and industrial projects. 

Alan Heinzen, Strategic Partner (Heinzen Manufacturing)

As company founder of Heinzen Manufacturing International, Alan has been at the leading edge of technical innovation in the fresh-cut industry for more than 30 years. His engineering experience and manufacturing background have enabled him to focus on designing quality equipment and processing lines with emphasis on production, maintenance and food safety issues. Alan has managed all facets of the design, production and installation of processing plants from the ground up, from value-added broccoli plants to complete lettuce processing lines. His experience includes working with customers such as Mann Packing, Gilroy Foods, Christopher Ranch, D’Arrigo Bros., Dixie Produce & Packaging, Fresh Express and Tanimura & Antle. Alan received his Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo.

Gregory Smith, Patent Attorney

Gregory has over 18 years of experience providing patent preparation and prosecution services in technical areas including but not limited to nanotechnology, medical devices, mechanical arts, chemistry, data storage technologies, biotechnology, agricultural technologies, integrated circuit devices, and manufacturing processes. Additional expertise includes over 16 years experience providing strategic guidance to companies and inventors in the areas of patents, trademarks, joint development agreements, and technology licensing. 

 

Can’t afford to donate, but still want to help?

If you just can’t spare the cash at the moment, you can still help!

You can share this campaign with your friends and tell them why you think this is a worthwhile project.

You can also share our campaign on Google+, LinkedIn, or Facebook. Or, if you are on twitter, tweet about our campaign.

Thank you!!
story_txt:
We build environmentally friendly water generators for those without clean drinking water. Our new smart technology, Dew Point Intelligence™, will make creating water from the air energy-efficient. Under the right conditions, our water can cost as little as two cents (USD) a liter.
It will take approximately three to four months for us to build a working prototype of our new smart technology. We know this technology will work but are lacking the funds to complete it. We have put together this campaign to help raise the $200,000 we need to do this.
 
Benefits of Dew Point Intelligence
To quote water.org, “Without water, life would not exist. It is a prerequisite for all human and economic development. Yet today, 780 million people – about one in nine – lack access to clean water. More than twice that many, 2.5 billion people, don’t have access to a toilet.”
We do not claim to be “the” one solution to the world’s water crisis but we know we can help if we are given a chance to complete our prototype.
By helping provide drinking water to people whose only water source is badly polluted or in scarce supply, we can help save lives. How pure is our water? Check out a water report from our ten-year-old prototype here.

Under the right conditions, our water can cost as little as two cents (USD) per liter. How much of a financial savings is this over current technology? The infographic below illustrates the savings from Dew Point Technology.

For a larger PDF version of this infographic, please click here.  

Our Dew Point Intelligence insures energy efficient water production by carefully tuning and controlling the refrigeration unit. Here are four ways it does this:

Dew point is maintained on the coil, which means water is being consistently created in an economical manner.
We are able to operate at much lower ambient temperature than current technology.
The coils will not freeze causing costly damage.
The compressors do not operate unless needed, sparing them from unnecessary wear. Energy savings can be up to 92% of the compressor energy (85% of the entire unit) at high humidity (90-95% humidity) and, this is at any operating ambient temperature when compared to existing refrigeration technology.

When natural disasters occur, bringing in one of our portable units can save lives. Earthquakes, tornados, hurricanes, and even floods can destroy water mains and pollute existing water supplies.
Below you will see an artist's rendering of how our Atmospheric Water Generator will be made mobile and transported to disaster zones. This unit is totally self-contained and ready to operate. For more information about our mobile unit, please visit our website here.

 
Environmentally friendly alternate energy sources are compatible with our water generators. Our machines are custom built and can be adapted to any adequate power source. Solar, wind, hydro-electricity, geo-thermal, and biomass power sources can all power our generators.

Unlike reverse osmosis and desalinization (more info here), we do not harm the environment. The only byproduct we produce is slightly warmer and cleaner air exiting the machine. And, when the water filters are periodically flushed with water, the resulting water can be used to water plants. 

Our water does not require bottling; it can be piped directly to a spigot in a home or a central location for many. Delivering water in this manner removes the need for manufacturing plastic water bottles, another process that causes harm to the environment.

Our water generators are manufactured in the United States (Gilroy, California). Completing our working prototype will lead to us being able to employ more people and will create a jobs for the people monitoring the water machine on location.
 
Dew Point Intelligence features remote monitoring. Our engineers can monitor and in many cases, reprogram the machine remotely via internet or satellite.

Dew Point Intelligence extends the lifespan of the compressors, adding longevity to the unit.
 
Where is the money going?
Our Goal:  $200,000
Indiegogo & PayPal fees:  $14,000
Hardware (A custom made stainless steel frame to hold the new compressors and new refrigeration components, copper piping, a new controller, miscelaneous sensors, wiring and refrigeration): $110,000        
Labor to install hardware:  $12,000
Extensive Programming:  $7,000          
Patent Work:  $18,000
Campaign gift costs with shipping:  $10,000
Campaign expenses:  $3,000    
Donation to Water.org:  $10,000
Remaining balance:  $16,000        
The remaing balance will cover additional costs of the campaign and project. The power costs alone (for running tests and operating) will use at least half of the remaing balance.
The company directors are not being paid. There is no profit taking at all. Funds are being used to strictly to reimburse real costs of the project and the campaign. Our help is contracted help.
All present internal hardware on our existing unit will be removed with the exception of the coils. 
 

How do you create water from the air?
Air and its humidity are drawn into a custom-built refrigeration unit through its air filters. The filtered air is then pulled to the refrigeration coils. At the correct dew point, newly created water will condense on the coils. 
The water is then collected, passed through a water filter and treated with ozone to keep it bacteria free during storage. In our sealed system, ozone will not allow any bacteria to grow.
 

For a larger PDF version of this infographic, please click here. 
 

What does Dew Point Intelligence do?

Atmospheric water generation varies with temperature and humidity just as solar and wind technologies vary with environmental changes. Temperatures can soar during the day lowering the humidity. And, temperatures cool off during the night causing the humidity to climb quite high. 
So, it is necessary to carefully program and adjust the atmospheric water generator to follow the changes in temperature and humidity that create dew point. Our smart technology expands the range of atmospheric water generation (from just above freezing to about 130° F/54.44°C) that is possible without deicing via hot gas by-pass technology. 
Are you curious about at what temperature and humidity dew point occurs? The chart below shows exactly when dew point occurs and water can be created on the fins of our coils. 

For a larger PDF view of this graphic, please click here.
 
We will be installing the new smart technology and testing it on our large machine located in Gilroy, California. The machine presently is a 60-ton refrigeration unit, with two independent refrigeration circuits utilizing two 15-ton compressors in tandem per independent circuit. It will be completely upgraded internally to install Dew Point Intelligence. For more information about the unit, please click here.

 
Below you will find a projected water production chart showing how much water can be produced after we install our Dew Point Intelligence on this unit.

Accuracy is within 10%, which is based on software accepted by the United States Department of Energy. For a larger PDF view of this graphic, please click here.
 
What happens if we raise more than $200,000?
Our initial goal is to raise $200,000. When we reach this goal, we will be able to install our Dew Point Intelligence along with the needed new hardware on our atmospheric water generator located in Gilroy, California. And, we will donate 5% of the funds we raise to water.org.
If we raise $1,000,000 or more we plan to build and donate water machines to those in need. Donating these machines will not only provide clean water to those in need, it will provide us with massive amounts of data to further improve our systems.
We will provide more information as our campaign progresses.
 
 


How do we calculate the energy savings from Dew Point Intelligence?

When an atmospheric water generator is operating at 100°F/37.77°C and 30% relative humidity, it requires 4 compressors at 100 amps /460 volts to reach a dew point of 63°F/17.22°C plus an additional 5°F (now 58°F/14.44°C) to insure proper temperature throughout the coil. Therefore 42°F (100° – 58° = 42°) of refrigeration is needed.
If the same generator is operating at 100°F/37.77°C and 85% relative humidity, one compressor is needed at 24 amps/460 volts to reach a dew point of at 95°F/17.22°C plus an additional 5°F (now 90°F/32.22°C) to insure proper temperature throughout the coil. Therefore only 10°F (100°F – 90°F = 10°F) of refrigeration is needed.
Dew Point Intelligence has created an energy savings of 76.2% or is using 23.8% (10 divided by 42 = .238) of full power at 30% humidity.
 
What is the average energy savings and how much would it cost for our DPI 18-21 to produce water in Thailand?

 
What is the average energy savings and how much would it cost for our DPI 18-21 to produce water in South Africa?

 

Our Dew Point Intelligence water costs explained

Water costs per gallon/liter are based on the following assumptions:

The cost and size of the atmospheric water generator with a ten-year amortization. We amortize for ten years even though the generator may last twenty-five years.
The cost of power (three phase commercial ratings only) per kWh at the unit’s location.
The temperature and humidity averages of the area for at least one year (hourly averages if available). High temperatures with low humidity are taken out of the formula because the atmospheric water generator is programmed to turn off and restart when humidity increases.
Low humidity happens predominately during peak energy costs (hot dry afternoons)...which is why the analysis needs to be done by the hour. The machine is programmed to cut out costly low humidity water production. The lower the humidity at any temperature, the less water the atmospheric water generator will produce (see the water production chart above) as well as having higher power costs.
At 25-30% humidity the atmospheric water generator is running at full power to meet dew point requirements. But, when humidity goes up, the refrigeration can be cut back considerably and to still meet dew point requirements to condense water. The client and our engineers decide upon the unit’s humidity cut off point.
An excellent example of how this works is found in the report we put together for Saudi Arabia.
Saudi Arabia is an excellent location for atmospheric water generation based not only on temperature and humidity but some of the best power costs we have seen to date. Below you will find an analysis chart showing the energy costs and water production based on a unit with a limited 19-hour water production schedule. The 19 hour water production schedule was agreed upon not just because of low humidity but the schedule also coincided with off-peak energy costs of $0.04 (USD).
The chart below is based on more than just energy cost differences. When we examined the past year’s temperatures and humidity, we discovered that approximately 26% of the year has very high temperatures with less than 29.5% humidity. We recommend that the unit be turned off during these times of high temperatures and low humidity.
The chart below clearly shows how choosing your operating schedule affects the final cost of water.

  
Additional Uses for Dew Point Intelligence
Our pending patent is for using refrigeration to remove condensation from the air. This smart technology works well for any dehumidification need. It minimizes energy use by tightly controlling the refrigeration system and reducing unnecessary compressor usage. Higher humidity at any temperature will also lower costs and the noise level.
The dehumidification process will mean significant energy savings for not just atmospheric water but also controlling humidity in commercial buildings, drying out water damaged homes and buildings, and much more.
 
Our Team
In 1998 (Incorporated in 2002), we started developing air to water generators. Unlike the dot-com organizations that were prevalent at that time, we did not want to grow the business only on an idea and the sale of stock. We wanted to serve our fellow human beings throughout the world. To that end, founders Jeffrey Bagley and Dick Corso have worked to develop technology that will help as many as possible.

Jeffrey W. Bagley, Co-Founder
Jeffrey is concurrently the President of The Gold Torch, a thriving jewelry manufacturing firm that he founded almost 30 years ago in San Jose, California.  Serving both domestic and international customers, earnings for The Gold Torch have grown three-fold over the last 10 years. Jeffrey directs product design, operations and all business development activities for the company. Over the past 40 years Mr. Bagley has owned several firms in the manufacturing and retail industries, taking concepts (such as a pivoting and locking clamp) from the idea stage and shepherding them into flourishing business ventures. Jeffrey also co-invented a liquid cooling system for computers and an optical on-demand defrost system for refrigeration with his brother, Alan Bagley.
Richard “Dick” Corso, Co-Founder

With over 40 years experience in Sales, Executive Management and Business Development, Dick has owned his own business for 30 years. His sales and entrepreneurial skills have ranked him in the top 1% of people in each of the three industries that he has been involved.  In his early sales career, he was a top producer in three different companies each of which had sales representatives in the thousands. Since founding Midwest LMI (Leadership Management Inc.) over 30 years ago, he has worked with start-up companies, Fortune 100 companies and the range of sizes in between. Some of his more noted clients are General Electric, Allstate, Sears, Abbott Labs, AT&T, The U.S. Postal Service, General Motors as well as other Governmental Agencies and Utility Companies and many more. Dick has personally been involved with the motivation training of several Olympic figure skaters. Dick has served on numerous Boards of Directors for both charitable and for-profit organizations. Some of the Boards that he served are The Boy Scouts of America, Cancer Treatment Research Foundation, International Organization of Women Executives and many more. He has also taught Management and Marketing classes at several Colleges and Universities such as Harper College and The University of Northeastern Illinois. 
Alan Bagley, Co-Founder
As an electrical and mechanical engineer, Alan was responsible for the introduction and design of Air to Water Technologies' atmospheric water generators. He was a valued advisor until he passed away in 2012.
Keith Lucia, Chief Refrigeration Guru
Keith has over 30 years of experience in the refrigeration industry. He has worked on refrigeration applications for both supermarkets and industrial projects. 
Alan Heinzen, Strategic Partner (Heinzen Manufacturing)
As company founder of Heinzen Manufacturing International, Alan has been at the leading edge of technical innovation in the fresh-cut industry for more than 30 years. His engineering experience and manufacturing background have enabled him to focus on designing quality equipment and processing lines with emphasis on production, maintenance and food safety issues. Alan has managed all facets of the design, production and installation of processing plants from the ground up, from value-added broccoli plants to complete lettuce processing lines. His experience includes working with customers such as Mann Packing, Gilroy Foods, Christopher Ranch, D’Arrigo Bros., Dixie Produce & Packaging, Fresh Express and Tanimura & Antle. Alan received his Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo.
Gregory Smith, Patent Attorney
Gregory has over 18 years of experience providing patent preparation and prosecution services in technical areas including but not limited to nanotechnology, medical devices, mechanical arts, chemistry, data storage technologies, biotechnology, agricultural technologies, integrated circuit devices, and manufacturing processes. Additional expertise includes over 16 years experience providing strategic guidance to companies and inventors in the areas of patents, trademarks, joint development agreements, and technology licensing.

story:
HELPING TO SAVE LIVES, PROPERTY, and PEACE OF MIND

Burglaries are scary and unpredictable. Gaining access into your home is not as hard as you might think. One frequently used technique is Key-Bumping.  Key-Bumping is a lock picking technique that uses a specially made key called a Bump Key, that can easily be purchased online. When the key is inserted, it is struck, causing the pins inside the lock cylinder to quickly move and allow the intruder entry with little to no damage to the lock or door. Unfortunately most people only look for a solution after a situation occurs. 

     

  

                    SLEEP BETTER, FEEL SAFER, and BE SAFER.......GET LOK-N-BLOK!

Because of Lok-N-Blok's unique wratcheting design, it can be used both upright and upside down if your deadbolt is configured under your door handle.

 

Some of the benefits of Lok-N-Blok:

  • Simple one piece design.
  • Easy to use.
  • 100% effective at preventing the deadbolt from turning when installed.
  • Can be used on almost any door with a standard deadbolt/door handle configuration.
  • Made of recyclable materials.
  • Made in the USA

What else can Lok-N-Blok do?

  • Helps to keep small children from opening doors.
  • Keeps unwanted visitors with a key out.
  • Provides peace of mind at night and during the day when home or away.

Our Goal

Our goal with Lok-N-Blok is to help provide safety and help to prevent break-ins from happening. With crime as it is today, we hope to help families NOT be the next victim of a home invasion and/or robbery.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please join us on this campaign and help protect your family. Also, please share this campaign with friends and family as Lok-N-Blok could very well save someones life!

story:
International Backers: If your country is not listed as a shipping option, please message us to have it added.


Design Improvements Video

Why it's awesome...

Patented 2-Gallon Aquarium Cleans Itself!... simply pour in clean water and dirty water flows out! It's so easy, a child can do it!

Hassle & Stress Free for You and SAFER FOR YOUR FISH! Other desktop aquariums force you to remove the fish, stones, plants and decorations before cleaning. This is a messy hassle for you and stressful and traumatic for your fish! After all, can you imagine being chased around with a net and snatched from your home?!?! With NoClean Aquariums, everything stays put and you stay clean and dry.

Eco-Friendly & Wallet-Friendly! No noisy pumps that can leak or break. No expensive replacement filters. No electricity use. No annoying cords to get in the way. Waste water collects for easy disposal or recycling as fertilizer for plants!

Display it Anywhere! GravityFlow2 is a fun, functional work of living art and stunning conversation piece wherever you display it. It’s smart, cordless design allows it to go where other aquariums can’t. Every aquarium includes both a black and white grommet ring and spout tip set and clear and copper spouts. Customize your bowl with a gold or silver plated spout by adding just $5 to your pledge!

Why did we start NoClean Aquariums?

Aquariums are fun to watch, great for kids and make an awe-inspiring addition to any room. The only problem is the cleaning – yuck! Talk about a messy, smelly, time-consuming chore!

So, a few short years ago we set out to solve this problem right here on Kickstarter by inventing the worlds first self-cleaning aquarium. Thanks to you, it was a big success!

After raising funds, we won a 1st Place Award at Global Pet Expo, North America’s largest pet trade show. We were featured on DIY Network's "I Want That!," as well as Fox & Friends.

We even collaborated with a manufacturing and distribution powerhouse to create My Fun Fish which is on TV and in major retailers!

Now we’re back to ask for your support for our newest 2-gallon aquarium: GravityFlow2™ Self-Cleaning Fish Bowl. Like the original, its super quick and easy to clean, just with a larger, classic form factor.


How GravityFlow Works:

 Footage from original Kickstarter launch

Dirt sinks through the rocks and gets trapped in the patented cleaning system built into the bottom of the bowl. This keeps your fish out of harms way and water crystal clear. When it’s time for a cleaning simply pour fresh water in and the dirty water flows out. It doesn't get easier than this!



GravityFlow2 automatically shuts-off when the job is done! This ensures no spills, drips or messes. You can even recycle the waste-water to nourish your plants!


Eco-Friendly & Wallet-Friendly!

GravtyFlow2 runs on GravityClean™ technology, which as you might have guessed, happens to work on the principal of… Gravity! This has a number of advantages over old-fashioned electric filters and pumps, including:

  • NO Noisy Pumps
  • NO Cords
  • NO Replacement Filters to Buy & Trash
  • NO Electricity Usage
  • NO Wet Hands
  • NO Mechanical Parts to Break
  • NO Hassles or Headaches!
  • Plus, the waste water collects for easy disposal or fertilizing plants!

Product Details & Dimensions

Turn the Fishbowl into an Easy-Watering Plant Terrarium!
